required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Research About Acute Compartment Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: Acute compartment syndrome (ACS) is defined as a clinical entity originated from trauma or other conditions, and remains challenging to diagnose and treat effectively. Threre is the controversy in diagnosing, treating ACS. It was found that there was no criterion about the ACS, and result unnecessary osteotomy. The presence of clinical assessment (5P) always means the necrosis of muscles and was the most serious or irreversible stage of ACS. Besides pressure methods, the threshold of pressure identifying ACS was also controversial.

primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about injury mechanism such as high falling accident, traffic accident, fall from standing height,Crushing

primary_outcome.measure: the time when the blister appeared
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about the time when the blister appeared after injury

primary_outcome.time_frame: time to when the surgery was conducted after 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about time to reconstructive surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about union time

primary_outcome.measure: No non-anatomic gap or step (larger than 5 mm)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about complications

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about complications

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about complications

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The relative data was collected about complications

primary_outcome.measure: blister skin immunochemistry and immunofluorescence analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: CK1, 5, 10, claudin 1, 2 and occludin as determined by immunochemistry analysis, and skin barrier proteins; claudin 1, 2 and occludin was determined by immunofluorescence analysis and qPCR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through hospitalization completion, an average of 1 month
through hospitalization completion, an average of 1 month
through hospitalization completion, an average of 1 month

other_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: tibial plateau fractures with blister observed
tibial plateau fractures without blister observed

intervention.description: if it was suspected with ACS, the fasciotomy was conducted. but if the blister observed, it means decreased conmpartment sydrome. therefore, the blister observed can avoid unnecessary fasciotomy to patients suspected with ACS

study_pop.textblock: The severe tibial plateau (Ⅴand Ⅵ according to Schatzker's classification) in our hospital who will be treated with open internal fixation in our hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fracture patients with Schatzker V and VI,
- Who were older than eighteen years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The exclusion criteria were pathologic, extra-articular proximal tibial fracture,
- Patients who was eighteen years or younger.
- Patients treated with other implant,
- underwent conservative management were also excluded.

facility.name: the Third Hospital of Hebei Medical University

reference.citation: Guo J, Yin Y, Jin L, Zhang R, Hou Z, Zhang Y. Acute compartment syndrome: Cause, diagnosis, and new viewpoint. Medicine (Baltimore). 2019 Jul;98(27):e16260. doi: 10.1097/MD.0000000000016260. Review.

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 2 years after the experiment was conducted
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: all authors focusing on ACS research
